name: Miggy Biller
content:
Margherita Joan (Miggy) Biller MBE is a British mathematics teacher, the head of mathematics at York College. She was named an MBE in the 2016 New Year Honours "for services to mathematics in further education".[1]
 Biller taught mathematics at St Peter's School, York before moving to York College in 1988.[2] At York College, she taught mathematics prodigy Daniel Lightwing, after whom the main character of the film X+Y was modeled.[3]
Her husband, Peter Biller, is a historian at the University of York.[4]

raw:
British mathematics teacher


Margherita Joan BillerMBENationalityBritishOccupationMathematics educatorSpouse(s)Peter BillerAcademic workDisciplineMathematicsInstitutionsYork CollegeSt Peter's School, YorkNotable studentsDaniel Lightwing

Margherita Joan (Miggy) Biller MBE is a British mathematics teacher, the head of mathematics at York College. She was named an MBE in the 2016 New Year Honours "for services to mathematics in further education".[1]
Biller taught mathematics at St Peter's School, York before moving to York College in 1988.[2] At York College, she taught mathematics prodigy Daniel Lightwing, after whom the main character of the film X+Y was modeled.[3]
Her husband, Peter Biller, is a historian at the University of York.[4]

References[edit]


^ "New Year Honours: Full list of Yorkshire's recipients", Yorkshire Post, 31 December 2015.

^ The Peterite (PDF), 405, 1987–1988, p. 5.

^ Barge, Danielle (17 March 2015), "X+Y: An emotional tale about a maths genius", Arts York.

^ Biller, Miggy, Ian Heavens memorial, archived from the original on 4 March 2016, retrieved 31 December 2015.
